article.headline: Samford 73, Eastern Illinois 69
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- Phillip Ramelli scored 22 points and Eddie Harper added 19 to lead Samford to a 73-69 win over Eastern Illinois Thursday night. Ramelli was 7-of-12 from the field and hit 8 of 10 free throws, while Harper hit 7-of-13 and was 4-of-10 from 3-point range for the Bulldogs (9-9, 4-3 Ohio Valley Conference). Tyson Dorsey also reached double figures for Samford, adding 12 points. The Panthers (3-14, 1-6) opened the game with a 10-4 run, driven by Emanuel Dildy. Samford answered with a pair of 3-pointers by Tyson Dorsey that put the Bulldogs ahead 17-15 at the 10:23 mark. Josh Gomes, who led the Panthers with 16 points, and Dildy pushed for a 9-0 stretch at the end of the half and the Panthers led 35-32 at halftime. Eastern Illinois had a 9-point advantage with 12:02 remaining, but the Bulldogs went on a 14-6 run that cut the deficit. With just under 3 minutes remaining, Ramelli hit a layup and Harper scored from the arc to chip away at the Panther's lead. A final 9-8 run sealed the victory for the Bulldogs. Aaron Patterson added 12 points for the Panthers, and Jake Sinclair scored 10.
